question:
Consider the following pairs of Mesolithic sites with states where they are located:
  1. Adamgarh - Madhya Pradesh
  2. Paisra - Bihar
  3. Bagor - Rajasthan
 Which of the above is/are correct?
explanation:
All of the above given pairs are correct.
  1. Adamgarh Hills is located in the Hoshangabad town of the Hoshangabad district in Madhya Pradesh. These rock shelters are situated on the south of Narmada river. These contain paintings of Prehistoric period. 
  2. PAISRA was one of the major discoveries of the last century , where evidence for the construction of huts and temporary shelters. It is located in Bihar. 
  3. Bagor is a town with Sub-Tehsil in Mandal tehsil of Bhilwara district of Rajasthan State, India.Bagor is the largest mesolithic habitation site discovered in India, and it is the only one to have been horizontally excavated so as to expose extensive living.
